intro: Quiina oiapocensis, commonly known as the Amazonian quina, is a shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
